1: To the Chanter, a song of the children of Korah upon almuth. In our troubles and adversity, we have found, that God is our refuge, our strength and help.
2: Therefore will we not fear, though the earth fell, and though the hills were carried into the middest of the sea.
3: Though the waters of the sea raged and were never so troublous, and though the mountains shook at the tempest of the same. Selah.
4: For there is a flood, which with his rivers rejoiceth the city of God, the holy dwelling of the most highest.
5: God is in the middest of her, therefore shall she not be removed: for God helpeth her, and that right early.
6: The Heathen are mad, the kingdoms make much ado: but when he sheweth his voice, the earth melteth away.
7: The LORD of Hosts is with us, the God of Jacob is our defense. Selah.
8: O come hither, and behold the works of the LORD, what destructions he hath brought upon the earth.
9: He hath made wars to cease in all the world: he hath broken the bow, he hath knapped the spear in sunder, and brent the chariots in the fire.
10: Be still then and confess that I am God: I will be exalted among the Heathen, I will be exalted upon earth.
11: The LORD of Hosts is with us, the God of Jacob is our defense. Selah.
